channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Lamborghini Has Been Planning an EV for Years. It’s Just Been Cancelled
item.description: EVs in their current form do not deliver the "specific emotional connection" Lamborghini says its cars need.

item.title: An AI Thought Experiment on Substack Is Sending The Stock Market Spiraling
item.description: AI is coming for everything, Wall Street seems to believe.

item.title: Start Your Surround Sound Journey With $50 off This Klipsch Soundbar
item.description: This soundbar is just the beginning, with the option to add wireless bookshelf speakers or a subwoofer.

item.title: Google clamps down on Antigravity 'malicious usage', cutting off OpenClaw users in sweeping ToS enforcement move
item.description: Google caused controversy among some developers this weekend and today, Monday, February 23rd, after restricting their usage of its new Antigravity "vibe coding" platform, alleging "maliciously usage." Some users who had been using the open source autonomous AI agent OpenClaw in conjunction with agents built on Antigravity, as well as those who had connected OpenClaw agents to their Gmails, claimed on social media that they lost access to their Google accounts. According to Google, said users had been using Antigravity to access a larger number of Gemini tokens via third-party platforms like O...

item.title: Lego’s Smart Play Bricks Sound Awful
item.description: Lego's controversial wave of tech-enhanced 'Star Wars' sets are getting into people's hands, and showing the premium being paid isn't quite worth it.

item.title: The Razer BlackShark V3 X takes the best gaming headset on the market and strips it down to under $100
item.description: The aviation-style BlackShark chassis, in a cheaper stripped-down form that preserves wireless connectivity and great comfort levels, elevates the new V3 X.

item.title: Amazon to Sink $12 Billion Into Data Centers as Wall Street (and Everyone Else) Turns Against AI Spending
item.description: Surely they can just spend their way out.

item.title: Procès réseaux sociaux | YouTube pas obnubilé par le temps passé sur sa plateforme, assure un dirigeant
item.description: Un dirigeant de YouTube a assuré lundi que la plateforme privilégiait l’utilité de ses contenus pour les internautes à la maximisation du temps passé sur le site, à l’orée de la troisième semaine du procès de la dépendance aux réseaux sociaux.

item.title: One engineer made a production SaaS product in an hour: here's the governance system that made it possible
item.description: Every engineering leader watching the agentic coding wave is eventually going to face the same question: if AI can generate production-quality code faster than any team, what does governance look like when the human isn't writing the code anymore?Most teams don't have a good answer yet. Treasure Data, a SoftBank-backed customer data platform serving more than 450 global brands, now has one, though they learned parts of it the hard way.The company today officially announced Treasure Code, a new AI-native command-line interface that lets data engineers and platform teams operate its full CDP thr...

item.title: IBM stock falls after Anthropic says AI can now modernize old software
item.description: IBM still profits from mainframes running decades-old COBOL systems. Anthropic says AI can migrate that software elsewhere. IBM stock was down 10% on Monday afternoon after Anthropic published a blog post about how its Claude Code tool can be used to modernize software written in the COBOL language, which handles large-scale batch transactions. Many of the software systems used by the federal government, banks, and airlines are written in COBOL, and most of those systems run on IBM mainframes....

item.title: 6 Best Duffel Bags We Tested While Traveling (2026)
item.description: Need to schlep some stuff? Consider these field-tested duffel bags. The Eastpak Duffel Pack S Tarp Black2 is our top pick.

item.title: Did Meta Just Accidentally Prove Smart Glasses Are a Liability?
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg traipsed into court with Ray-Ban Meta AI glasses on and got a scolding.

item.title: Anthropic says DeepSeek, Moonshot, and MiniMax used 24,000 fake accounts to rip off Claude
item.description: Anthropic dropped a bombshell on the artificial intelligence industry Monday, publicly accusing three prominent Chinese AI laboratories — DeepSeek, Moonshot AI, and MiniMax — of orchestrating coordinated, industrial-scale campaigns to siphon capabilities from its Claude models using tens of thousands of fraudulent accounts.The San Francisco-based company said the three labs collectively generated more than 16 million exchanges with Claude through approximately 24,000 fake accounts, all in violation of Anthropic's terms of service and regional access restrictions. The campaigns, Anthropic said,...

item.title: Dark Sky’s Creators Are Back With a New Weather App
item.description: The new Acme Weather app includes alternate forecasts predictions.

item.title: Forget the wooden ruler — I measured the Blizzard of 2026 with my iPhone
item.description: Your iPhone has a hidden feature for measuring almost anything, including the snow totals from this once-in-a-lifetime blizzard.

item.title: Before Cerebras, there was Amdahl: How legendary US engineer was way ahead of his time with wafer-scale integration and plotted supercomputer performance for the humble PC 43 years ago
item.description: How Gene Amdahl turned IBM’s mainframe blueprint into a rival empire — and gambled on wafer-scale silicon decades before the AI era made it viable.

item.title: After a Near-Perfect Test, NASA’s Artemis 2 Rocket Is Rolling Back to the Garage
item.description: NASA has delayed the launch of this historic mission to April, but repairs could take even longer.

item.title: Yes, Dunkin’s massive 48-ounce coffee bucket is real: List of sightings grows at locations in multiple states
item.description: The donut chain has confirmed that it is indeed testing a jumbo-sized collectible container that could help keep you caffeinated for days. The Big Gulp might have some new competition in the realm of giant beverages from an unlikely dark horse: Dunkin‘.

item.title: Toutes les nouveauté d’iOS 26.4 : ce qui va changer pour votre iPhone
item.description: Apple a livré hier soir la première bêta d'iOS 26.4, et alors qu'on attendait des nouvelles de la version améliorée de Siri, on a eu à la place quelques petites améliorations ici et là, des playlists générées par IA dans Apple Music, et du neuf pour l'app Podcasts.

item.title: The Second ‘Scream’ Trilogy Originally Went Very Differently
item.description: Kevin Williamson, series co-creator and 'Scream 7' director, just revealed his version of the story after 'Scream 4.'

item.title: Bitcoin Miner Bitdeer Tells Market Not to Worry After Selling Entire Crypto Stash
item.description: Bitdeer's decision "should not be a concern for the broader market," it says.

item.title: Technics just added its famed ΔΣ direct drive tech to a turntable that won't cost thousands — and I want one
item.description: A unique gray finish, automatic tonearm, pre-fitted Ortofon cartridge and built in phono stage too? Where do I buy?!

item.title: Reckless YouTuber Threatens Fabric of Reality by Wiring Together 400 Car Batteries
item.description: "Mom, the guy next door is doing nuclear fusion again!"

item.title: With AI, investor loyalty is (almost) dead: At least a dozen OpenAI VCs now also back Anthropic
item.description: While some dual investors are understandable, others were more shocking, and signal the disregard of a longstanding ethical conflict-of-interest rule.

item.title: Olaf is hosting a drawing class at Disney World — and animators will teach you to draw him and other classic characters
item.description: Disney World’s The Magic of Disney Animation will feature an audio-animatronic Olaf hosting a drawing experience alongside Disney animators, where guests learn to sketch Disney characters – including Olaf himself.
